page.title: 19Newton Bridge Closure 1984
page.content: {Suddenly,}in September British Rail announced that,due to a weakened structure,the{A49 road bridge}at Newton must{close for repair.}Traffic surveys by school children showed over 200 vehicles an hour crossed the bridge.The council made arrangements for heavy traffic to use the A4110,& {light traffic}to use{Bowley Lane}to get to Leominster from Hope.Intense {protests}by local people were{ignored. In October the bridge closed.Diverted traffic,laboriously ground its way along these{inadequate lanes.}The very narrow Bowley Lane soon turned in to a {quagmire of mud.}Grass verges were all churned up and cars got stuck.Work on the bridge proceeded.The old structure was removed down to the brick lining. {Reinforced concrete}was infilled and a sturdy brick parapet was built at road level.{A49 reopened Christmas 1984.
